itemDescription: British General and member of parliament

wikipedia_page.main: General Sir Charles Cameron Shute  (3 January 1816 – 30 April 1904) was a British army officer and Conservative Party politician.

response: * 1886 Gen. Charles Cameron Shute app. 28 March 1886
*1878–1886: Gen. Sir Charles Cameron Shute, KCB
* Sir Charles Cameron Shute (1816–1904), British army general and Conservative Party politician

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1874 United Kingdom general election

response: Shute was born in Dorking, Surrey, the son of Col. Deane Christian Shute of the British Indian Army, and his wife, Elizabeth Isabella Brownlow. He was educated at Marlborough College and abroad. He was the nephew of General Sir Charles Cameron Shute (1816–1904). Francis Browne, 4th Baron Kilmaine married his sister Alice Emily Shute.

He was again a candidate at the next general election in 1874 and on this occasion he was elected along with his fellow Conservative, Major-General Charles Cameron Shute.  He was only to serve a single term in the House of Commons as the Liberals regained the two Brighton seats at the next general election in 1880.
*Lt.-Gen. and Honorary General Charles Cameron Shute

In 1877, Browne married Alice Emily, daughter of Col. Dean Shute, sister of Sir Cameron Shute, and niece of General Sir Charles Cameron Shute. They had one son, John Edward Deane Browne, who married Lady Aline Kennedy, daughter of the 3rd Marquess of Ailsa.
